text:
- We at Phrase, we provide
software for localization.

Our mission is open
doors to global business

by giving everybody access
to the content they need
in the language they speak.

The challenge is that
there is a lot of data,
which are coming 24/7,
sometimes in not predictable patterns.

And to keep the flow and to
keep all the processes running,
it has to be running 24/7.

So our infrastructure has to
be ready for sudden spikes
and providing that all around the world,
all around the cloud.

We use generative AI
and similar techniques

to enrich and improve our
data and predictability

of the localization and
making sure the process

is as smooth as possible with
data as good as possible.

We use AWS infrastructure
to do all the things

around our generative AI
and large language models.
So training data, evaluating quality,

and making sure that we provide
quality to our customers.
I think all the data in AWS allows us
to use different services,
allow different teams to use that.

Rather than moving it and
shifting it here and there,
we just have this data and we are building
all the processes around the data,

not inserting data in
a separate small space.

The biggest advantage
of AWS is the capacity

and ability to try new things
without much thinking upfront.

So imagine a data engineer
approaches us and says like,
"We need 20 GPU cards."
On-premise, this takes weeks.
In AWS, it's just a few API calls.
We chose AWS because it is a leader

in infrastructure as a service
and platform as a service,
and it supports us working our use cases

and our business, whatever
we need, whenever we need.
The most difficult outcome of using AWS

is that we have a solid
foundations for all our use cases,

and we can provide our customers
the best service we can.
They're always welcoming us,

and they are always helping
us to do things better,

which allows us to do things
better for our customers.
(inspirational music)
